snippet: Of the 103 people taken into custody during overnight protests on Monday and Tuesday, 23 were from out of state, and the influx has bothered some residents.
abstract: Many people from across the United States are descending on Ferguson, Mo, to take part in protests over Michael Brown shooting; some locals worry that outsiders are coming to cause trouble, and not to protest peacefully.

byline.original: By MICHAEL WINES and EMMA G. FITZSIMMONS
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Frances Robles, John Eligon, Alan Blinder, Campbell Robertson and Tanzina Vega from Ferguson, Mo.

lead_paragraph: Of the 103 people taken into custody during overnight protests on Monday and Tuesday, 23 were from out of state, and the influx has bothered some residents.

headline.main: What Started as a Local Protest in Missouri Grows Into a Center of National Activism
headline.print_headline: What Started as a Local Protest in Missouri Grows Into a Center of National Activism
